intro: Resinanthus abbreviatus subsp. moaensis, commonly known as the Moaensis Resinanthus, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and unique floral structures. The plant produces a resinous substance, which is a distinguishing botanical feature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
